thig4.1:1.1_0: Kassapa is the son and heir of the Buddha,
thig4.1:1.2_0: whose mind is immersed in samādhi.
thig4.1:1.4_0: he sees heaven and places of loss,
thig4.1:2.1_0: and have attained the end of rebirth:
thig4.1:2.4_0: that the brahmin is a master of the three knowledges.
thig4.1:3.1_0: In exactly the same way, Bhaddā Kāpilānī
thig4.1:3.2_0: is master of the three knowledges, destroyer of death.
thig4.1:3.4_0: having vanquished Māra and his mount.”
thig4.1:4.1_0: Seeing the danger of the world,
thig4.1:4.3_0: Now we are tamed, our defilements have ended;
thig4.1:6.1_0: The Book of the Fours is finished.
